ProjectDescr.Title: Development in defense of multi-organ damage by particulate matter
ProjectDescr.Description: Physicochemical characteristics and 3D morphological analysis of (ultra)fine dust in Korea Expression patterns of markers for damage prediction/diagnosis of respiratory diseases mediated by fine dust and analysis of transcription factors Establishment of an animal model of cancer metastasis induced by fine dust using various types of cancer Analysis of genes of harmful substances induced by fine dust through single cell genome analysis of lung tissue Study on the pathogenic mechanism of harmful substances induced by fine dust Identification of herbal medicine samples that can control fine dust-induced inflammatory responses Establishment of an animal model of aging mediated by (ultra)fine dust Analysis of candidate substances that regulate Caspase-1 activity after exposure to (ultra)fine dust Discovery of candidate substances that regulate macrophage inflammatory responses after (ultra)fine dust induction Study on controlling (ultra)fine dust-induced inflammatory responses through macrophage type conversion Analysis of the regulation mechanism of signal transduction in fine dust-induced intestinal diseases Analysis of the mechanism of controlling damage to the host immune system by pathogenic infectious agents derived from PM Verification of the productivity of antimicrobial peptides derived in the first stage for controlling pathogenic bacteria induced by fine dust Analysis of genomic changes due to the influence of fine dust in a stem cell-based model Selection of key regulator targets responding to fine dust and analysis of sub-mechanisms Discovery of respiratory microbiome controlling fine dust-induced opportunistic infections

Grant.Title: Development in defense of multi-organ damage by particulate matter

Organization.Name: Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology
